title: James Jordan calls for Strictly to sack Craig Revel-Horwood as feud rumbles on
text:
James wants Craig fired from the Strictly Come Dancing (Picture: BBC/Rex)

James Jordan may have left Strictly Come Dancing in 2013, but his spats with judge Craig Revel-Horwood aren’t going anywhere.

The pro, who appears on eight seasons of the show, has now called for the resident ‘Mr Nasty’ of the judging panel to get the sack – insisting that ‘noone would miss him’ if he left.

‘The show doesn’t need Craig. He should go,’ he told Daily Star. ‘If Craig was gone they wouldn’t notice any difference at all.

‘The viewers wouldn’t miss him either. No-one would miss him.’

Craig and James’s continual rowing resulted in Craig getting a bodyguard last year – however when confirming that he added that James was using their feud as a ‘way to get publicity.’

After leaving Strictly James continues to watch the show, and now gives his own marks to each new celebrity taking on the challenge via Twitter (and, as always, isn’t afraid to go against the judges).

Advertisement

Advertisement

He also won Dancing on Ice last year, and is about to become a father for the first time.

Meanwhile, back on the Strictly dancefloor, Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton became the second pair to leave the competition.

Despite David James falling into the bottom two for the second time in a row with Nadiya Bychkova, their Charleston routine to Kill Bill’s WooHoo by The 5, 6, 7, 8s landed them the lowest score on the leader board.

Oti Mabuse and Kelvin Fletcher scored the first 10s of the season, earning 38 for their Mary Poppins Returns routine to track Trip a Little Light Fantastic.

More: Strictly Come Dancing Who left Strictly Come Dancing last night in the second elimination of the new series? Stacey Dooley is proud of boyfriend Kevin Clifton after Strictly exit Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton become second couple eliminated on Strictly Come Dancing

It was all sorts of dramatic on Saturday night’s Movie Week, with Craig even putting his foot in his mouth over Anton Du Beke’s Austin Powers routine – thinking the pro was wearing false teeth when he wasn’t.

Craig could do nothing but apologise as everyone cracked up laughing, including Anton – so we think he got away with it.

Strictly Come Dancing returns Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly's James Jordan and Craig Revel-Horwood have had a well-documented icy relationship, and it looks it's not getting any better.
